text: Two teams of Chinese Expeditionary Force, one come from Yunnan and another from India, and also Allied armies reunion at Mong-yu in January 1945 during the Battle of Northern Burma and Western Yunnan. Mong-yu (N23°58'23" E97°59'00"), Burma, was at the junction of the World War II-famed Ledo Road and the Burma Road. It is located about 10 miles (17 kilometers) southwest of Wanting (N24°05 E98°04) in southwestern China, where the Burma Road crossed the Burma-China border. ==References== Category:Geography of Shan State Category:Populated places in Shan State
title: Mong-Yu
